moves.1. e4: This was a strange game white amounted a large pressure on the center and managed to get a quality exchange, but I found some compensation on the fact that white's king remained exposed and his rooks unconnected... white's attacks depended solely on one piece at a time, and were never well coordinated, finally white blundered his queen to lose the game
moves.7... Nd8 8. d6 cxd6 9. Na3 Bxf2+: white can't capture the bishop due to Nxe4+ wining it back
moves.12... Bd6 13. Nb5 h6: quid pro quo... do you want my bishop... give me your's... or face a worst position
moves.14. Bh4 a6: now inviting the exchange of knight by y dark squares bishop, as it probably my worst developed piece
moves.15. Nxd6+: he does so, exchanges his developed knight for my worst piece
moves.15... Qxd6: my position is still a bit cramped but is getting better
moves.16. Qe2: now white starts to put pressure on my e pawn
moves.16... O-O: to ensure safety white's king still exposed, I can now start to develops my remaining pieces to harass him
moves.17. Bg3: I was expecting Bf2 to threaten Bc5
moves.17... b5: gains space and waits to see what white has to show, probably Bxe5
moves.19. Bb3: to allow the c4 push maybe the idea of this move
moves.19... Bb7: with the idea of connecting rooks or developing Rc8
moves.20. Qd3 a5 21. Bd4: and white goes to force the quality exchange
moves.22. Bc5 Qc7: threatening Qxc3 after Bxf8, and preventing 24.Qxb5 after 23.Bxf8 Kxf8 due to 24...Qxc3 threatening to win both white's rooks
moves.23. Bxf8 Kxf8 24. bxa5 Rxa5 25. Qd4: ? I don't see the point of this move... is it to get to b4?
moves.25... Ra6: preparing d6 if Qb4 is white's idea and threatening to create a permanent weaken d5 pawn, plus a weak light squared bishop
moves.26. Nh4 Bxd5: ok, if you don't want it I'll keep it for you... and now with a pawn and a piece for my rook I can start to make some serious threats on white's exposed king
moves.28. c4 Ne6: development completed all my pieces are active now
moves.29. Qb2 bxc4 30. Bxe6 c3: still leaving white with another hanging piece to keep the initiative
moves.31. Qa3 dxe6: and now grab the bishop to play with a better pawn structure on the king side I need to protect further my king and keep white under pressure to avoid his only wining chance to push the a pawn
moves.32. Nf3 Kg8: further protection of my king now with h7 to hide from white's queen and any perpetual threats
moves.33. Rc1 Qc4+: finally the compensation for the sacrificed material
moves.34. Kg1 Rd3 35. h3 Kh7: avoiding back rank tactics to free my knight
moves.36... Qxb4: If a queen move I was expecting either Qa5 or Qb3... this move loses on the spot??
